intro: Phebalium nudum, commonly known as the slender wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Phebalium nudum is well adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
